Extension class for working with Attribute. Contains some helpful methods to working with attributes.
AttributeUtils is a collection of methods developed to help retrieve Attribute information for Types and methods in C# through Reflection.

member.summary: Fast alternative version of the RemoveAt function. Overwrites the element at the specified index with the last element in the list, then removes the last element, thus lowering the inherent O(n) cost to O(1). Intended to be used on "unordered" lists only.

member.summary: From: http://habrahabr.ru/post/249681/ AES (Advanced Encryption Standard) with 128-bit key. (By default). 128-bit AES is like NIST, but without 256-bit AES. 256-bit AES slower, than 128-bit AES. (~40%). Dont try to secure data in/from RAM!

member.summary: Key length.

member.name: T:ZFramework.Unity.Common.Secure.B64X
member.summary: From: http://habrahabr.ru/post/249681/ Simple and fast Base64 XOR crypt method with dynamic key generation on run. Use this method to protect data in/from RAM. Don't use this method to protect data outside of RAM.

member.name: T:Amib.Threading.Internal.EventWaitHandleFactory
member.summary: EventWaitHandleFactory class. This is a static class that creates AutoResetEvent and ManualResetEvent objects. In WindowCE the WaitForMultipleObjects API fails to use the Handle property of XxxResetEvent. It can use only handles that were created by the CreateEvent API. Consequently this class creates the needed XxxResetEvent and replaces the handle if it's a WindowsCE OS.

member.name: M:Amib.Threading.Internal.WorkItem.WaitAll(Amib.Threading.IWaitableResult[],System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Threading.WaitHandle)
member.summary: Wait for all work items to complete
member.param: Array of work item result objects
The number of milliseconds to wait, or Timeout.Infinite (-1) to wait indefinitely.
true to exit the synchronization domain for the context before the wait (if in a synchronized context), and reacquire it; otherwise, false.
A cancel wait handle to interrupt the wait if needed
member.returns: true when every work item in waitableResults has completed; otherwise false.

member.name: M:Amib.Threading.Internal.WorkItem.WaitAny(Amib.Threading.IWaitableResult[],System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Threading.WaitHandle)
member.summary: Waits for any of the work items in the specified array to complete, cancel, or timeout
member.param: Array of work item result objects
The number of milliseconds to wait, or Timeout.Infinite (-1) to wait indefinitely.
true to exit the synchronization domain for the context before the wait (if in a synchronized context), and reacquire it; otherwise, false.
A cancel wait handle to interrupt the wait if needed
member.returns: The array index of the work item result that satisfied the wait, or WaitTimeout if no work item result satisfied the wait and a time interval equivalent to millisecondsTimeout has passed or the work item has been canceled.

member.name: M:Amib.Threading.IWorkItemResult`1.GetResult
member.summary: Get the result of the work item. If the work item didn't run yet then the caller waits.
member.returns: The result of the work item

members.member:
Get the result of the work item. If the work item didn't run yet then the caller waits until timeout.
The result of the work item On timeout throws WorkItemTimeoutException

Get the result of the work item. If the work item didn't run yet then the caller waits until timeout.
The result of the work item On timeout throws WorkItemTimeoutException

Get the result of the work item. If the work item didn't run yet then the caller waits until timeout or until the cancelWaitHandle is signaled.
Timeout in milliseconds, or -1 for infinite
true to exit the synchronization domain for the context before the wait (if in a synchronized context), and reacquire it; otherwise, false.
A cancel wait handle to interrupt the blocking if needed The result of the work item On timeout throws WorkItemTimeoutException On cancel throws WorkItemCancelException

Get the result of the work item. If the work item didn't run yet then the caller waits until timeout or until the cancelWaitHandle is signaled.
The result of the work item On timeout throws WorkItemTimeoutException On cancel throws WorkItemCancelException

member.name: P:Amib.Threading.IWorkItemResult`1.IsCompleted
member.summary: Gets an indication whether the asynchronous operation has completed.

member.name: P:Amib.Threading.IWorkItemResult`1.IsCanceled
member.summary: Gets an indication whether the asynchronous operation has been canceled.

member.name: P:Amib.Threading.IWorkItemResult`1.State
member.summary: Gets the user-defined object that contains context data for the work item method.

member.name: M:Amib.Threading.IWorkItemResult`1.Cancel
member.summary: Same as Cancel(false).

member.name: M:Amib.Threading.IWorkItemResult`1.Cancel(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Cancel the work item execution. If the work item is in the queue then it won't execute If the work item is completed, it will remain completed If the work item is in progress then the user can check the SmartThreadPool.IsWorkItemCanceled property to check if the work item has been cancelled. If the abortExecution is set to true then the Smart Thread Pool will send an AbortException to the running thread to stop the execution of the work item. When an in progress work item is canceled its GetResult will throw WorkItemCancelException. If the work item is already cancelled it will remain cancelled
member.param: When true send an AbortException to the executing thread.
member.returns: Returns true if the work item was not completed, otherwise false.

member.summary: Get the work item's priority

member.summary: Return the result, same as GetResult()

member.name: P:Amib.Threading.IWorkItemResult`1.Exception
member.summary: Returns the exception if occured otherwise returns null.

member.summary: The default option to run the post execute (CallToPostExecute.Always)

member.summary: The default work item priority (WorkItemPriority.Normal)

member.name: F:Amib.Threading.SmartThreadPool.DefaultStartSuspended

member.name: F:Amib.Threading.SmartThreadPool.DefaultFillStateWithArgs
member.summary: The default fill state with params. (false) It is relevant only to QueueWorkItem of Action<...>/Func<...>

member.name: F:Amib.Threading.SmartThreadPool.DefaultAreThreadsBackground
member.summary: The default thread backgroundness. (true)

member.name: F:Amib.Threading.SmartThreadPool.DefaultApartmentState
member.summary: The default apartment state of a thread in the thread pool. The default is ApartmentState.Unknown which means the STP will not set the apartment of the thread. It will use the .NET default.

member.name: P:Amib.Threading.SmartThreadPool.IsWorkItemCanceled

member.summary: Specifies how to treat the time value when converting between string and .

member.name: F:Newtonsoft.Json.DateTimeZoneHandling.Local
member.summary: Treat as local time. If the object represents a Coordinated Universal Time (UTC), it is converted to the local time.

member.name: F:Newtonsoft.Json.DateTimeZoneHandling.Utc
member.summary: Treat as a UTC. If the object represents a local time, it is converted to a UTC.

member.name: F:Newtonsoft.Json.DateTimeZoneHandling.Unspecified
member.summary: Treat as a local time if a is being converted to a string. If a string is being converted to , convert to a local time if a time zone is specified.

member.name: F:Newtonsoft.Json.DateTimeZoneHandling.RoundtripKind
member.summary: Time zone information should be preserved when converting.

member.name: T:Newtonsoft.Json.DefaultValueHandling
member.summary: Specifies default value handling options for the .

member.name: F:Newtonsoft.Json.DefaultValueHandling.Include
member.summary: Include members where the member value is the same as the member's default value when serializing objects. Included members are written to JSON. Has no effect when deserializing.

member.name: F:Newtonsoft.Json.DefaultValueHandling.Ignore
member.summary: Ignore members where the member value is the same as the member's default value when serializing objects so that is is not written to JSON. This option will ignore all default values (e.g. null for objects and nullable types; 0 for integers, decimals and floating point numbers; and false for booleans). The default value ignored can be changed by placing the on the property.

member.name: F:Newtonsoft.Json.DefaultValueHandling.Populate
member.summary: Members with a default value but no JSON will be set to their default value when deserializing.

member.name: F:Newtonsoft.Json.DefaultValueHandling.IgnoreAndPopulate
member.summary: Ignore members where the member value is the same as the member's default value when serializing objects and sets members to their default value when deserializing.

member.name: T:Newtonsoft.Json.FloatFormatHandling
member.summary: Specifies float format handling options when writing special floating point numbers, e.g. , and with .

member.name: F:Newtonsoft.Json.FloatFormatHandling.String
member.summary: Write special floating point values as strings in JSON, e.g. "NaN", "Infinity", "-Infinity".

member.name: F:Newtonsoft.Json.FloatFormatHandling.Symbol
member.summary: Write special floating point values as symbols in JSON, e.g. NaN, Infinity, -Infinity. Note that this will produce non-valid JSON.

member.name: F:Newtonsoft.Json.FloatFormatHandling.DefaultValue
member.summary: Write special floating point values as the property's default value in JSON, e.g. 0.0 for a property, null for a property.

member.name: T:Newtonsoft.Json.FloatParseHandling
member.summary: Specifies how floating point numbers, e.g. 1.0 and 9.9, are parsed when reading JSON text.

member.name: F:Newtonsoft.Json.FloatParseHandling.Double
member.summary: Floating point numbers are parsed to .

member.name: F:Newtonsoft.Json.FloatParseHandling.Decimal
member.summary: Floating point numbers are parsed to .
